Text:
Alright, let's move on to the second evaluation.
Up next, our judges are...the children!

Contestants, you'll be engaging with the kids
gathered on stage. After all, if you're fit to be
Santa, playing with kids should be a breeze!

(Play...? What am I supposed to do...? What does
"play" even mean?)

(...Am I even good with children? Even my own younger
sister keeps her distance from me...)

I just need to play with these kids, right? Leave it
to me.
Lady Beatrix...?
Hey, little girl. Want to become a hunter?
Hunter...? What's that?

You can shoot down birds and four-legged creatures
with a bow and arrow. That's the essence of hunting.
We elves learn how to hunt through play first.

But we don't really hunt living creatures for fun.
What we'll be doing now is "pretend hunting."
Just imagine you have a bow and arrowâ€”
This lady's scary!
D-Did I make her cry...? How...?
(It seems Lady Beatrix is also struggling...)
Hunting? Who even does that nowadays? Ahaha!
Yeah, totally. Lame!

Those born as elves dedicate their lives to hunting.
It's no laughing matter.

What does that even mean? Show us something fun
instead!

...That's not a very polite thing to say, especially
to someone you just met who's your elder... How
about speaking a bit more respectfully?

Huh? But we're in charge right now, you know? 'Cause
we're the "judges"!

(...These children are a handful. And I can't be too
strict with them... What's my next move?)

You guys are super strong, right? Then let's see if
you can handle our squad move!
Now's our chance! Take this...huh?

Wh-Where'd they go?! My sword's gone, too... Where's
everything?!
Looking for this?
Whoa! Wh-When did you...?!

The moment you lifted that toy. I'm sorry, my body
just reacted.
Your squad needs a lot of work.
W-We've been busted...

Using power to recklessly attack others... Even if
you are just children, I can't let that slide.

...What's your move, young man? Princess Iris is
serious.
Whoa! You guys're so cool!
Huh...?
What's with the sudden change of heart?

Man, you're awesome, "Goddess of War"! Teach me that
move you just did!
Me too, me too!

I can teach you, but...before that, isn't there
something you need to do first?

When you ask someone to teach you, you should
bow your head and say "please teach me." This is
especially important in martial arts.

True strength comes from a pure heart.
Come on, try again.
Ulp... S-Sorry. Please teach me your sword technique!
Please teach me, too!
Heheh. Alright.

Oh, another unexpected turn of events! A sword lesson
with Lady Beatrix and Princess Iris! The children
look ecstatic!

My, my, just look at Princess Iris's gentle smile.
She truly is wonderful.

Lady Beatrix's dignified expression is also
impressive. It's clear she's earnest in her
desire to teach them.

And with that, the second evaluation wraps up,
with both Iris and Beatrix passing. The contest
enters a brief intermission.
